FuncDef:
The time-range command sets the access permission time range for a local access user.
The undo time-range command deletes the access permission time range for a local access user. The time-range command sets the access permission time range for a local access user. The undo time-range command deletes the access permission time range for a local access user. By default, a local access user can access the network anytime. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the access permission time range of the local account. time-name specifies the name of the access permission time range.
The value is a string of 1 to 32  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: After a local access user account is created, the account has no expiration date by default. To restrict the network access time of a local account, run the local-user time-range command. After the command is executed, the account can access network resources only in the specified time range.
